query: Where is the new location for the Lost and Found office?
retrieved_document:
Dear Students,

We would like to inform you that the Lost and Found Office has been relocated. Effective from March 1st, 2025, all lost items will be handled through the new office at Building C, Ground Floor, Room 105. The new location is equipped with better facilities to ensure faster processing and safekeeping of personal belongings. Students who have lost items prior to the relocation are also encouraged to check the new office. Operating hours remain the same: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM on weekdays.

Sincerely,
Student Services
llm_response: The new Lost and Found office is located at Building C, Ground Floor, Room 105, starting from March 1, 2025. It features improved facilities to facilitate quicker processing and safer handling of belongings.

query: Has the cafeteria updated its opening hours?
retrieved_document:
Dear Students,

The university cafeteria has made slight adjustments to its opening hours effective from February 15th, 2025. The new opening hours will be from 8:00 AM to 6:30 PM on weekdays. Weekend service remains suspended until further notice due to low demand. Menu updates will also occur twice per week instead of once, aiming to introduce a broader range of meal options. We hope these changes enhance your campus experience.

Warm regards,
Facility Management
past_interactions: What are the old cafeteria hours?
The cafeteria was open from 7:30 AM to 7:00 PM on weekdays previously.
llm_response: Yes, the university has updated the cafeteria opening hours. Previously, the cafeteria was operational from 7:30 AM to 7:00 PM during weekdays, but starting from February 15, 2025, the opening hours have been adjusted to 8:00 AM to 6:30 PM. This change includes weekend service being suspended until further notice, which reflects the university's decision to adjust the operating hours based on current circumstances.

query: When is the summer school registration deadline?
retrieved_document:
The summer school registration for the academic year 2024-2025 will commence on May 5th, 2025, and end on May 19th, 2025. Late registration will not be entertained unless justified by a medical or emergency reason, accompanied by proper documentation. Course offerings are listed on the academic portal and are subject to minimum enrollment requirements.

Please refer to the official Summer Programs Guide for full policies.
llm_response: The summer school registration for the academic year 2024-2025 begins on May 5, 2025, and concludes on May 19, 2025. Late registration may be allowed under specific circumstances, such as a valid medical or emergency justification supported by appropriate documentation.

query: Are there exceptions for 4th-year students regarding summer school?
past_interactions: When is the summer school registration deadline?
Registration is open from May 5th to May 19th.
What documents are needed for summer school?
Only standard enrollment form and advisor approval are required.
llm_response:
4th-year students typically do not have additional registration requirements beyond the standard process outlined in the documents. Therefore, they can proceed as usual by signing up through the standard Enrollment Form and obtaining approval from their academic advisors. There are no exceptions suggested beyond the existing requirements. 

**Answer:** 4th-year students can register freely following the standard procedure without needing additional approvals beyond what's specified.

query: Are there new parking regulations for students?
retrieved_document:
Attention all students,

Effective from March 20th, 2025, new parking regulations have been introduced. All students must display updated parking permits on their vehicles. The designated student parking zones are now limited to Parking Lot B and C. Unauthorized vehicles parked outside these zones will be fined. Temporary parking passes for visitors are available at the Security Office.

University Transportation Services
past_interactions: Where can I get a parking permit?
Permits are issued at the Security Office, Building A basement.
llm_response: The university has implemented new parking regulations effective from March 20, 2025. Students are required to display updated parking permits on their vehicles and must park within Parking Lot B and C. Unauthorized vehicles outside these zones incur fines, while temporary visitor passes are available at the Security Office. For the most up-to-date and accurate information, please visit the university's official website.

query: Where is the academic calendar posted?
retrieved_document:
The updated academic calendar for the 2025-2026 academic year has been posted on the Registrar's Office page as of January 10th, 2025. It outlines all key dates including registration periods, holidays, and graduation ceremonies.

Check the Registrar's official portal for updates.
llm_response: The academic calendar for the 2025-2026 academic year was publicly posted on the Registrar's Office's official webpage as of January 10th, 2025. You can find more details by checking the Registrar's official portal.

query: Can you also tell me if cafeteria hours apply for weekend brunch?
past_interactions: Has the cafeteria updated its opening hours?
Weekday hours are now 8:00 AM - 6:30 PM; weekend service suspended.

llm_response: No relevant information was found regarding scholarship deadlines.

query: What is the maximum course load allowed for summer school?
retrieved_document: Students enrolled in summer school may register for a maximum of 2 courses, totaling no more than 8 credits, unless approved otherwise by academic advisors for specific graduation plans.
llm_response: The maximum course load for summer school is typically 2 courses, equating to 8 credits per semester. However, this limit can vary depending on academic advisors' approvals. Students are encouraged to consult their advisors for the most accurate information regarding each semester.

We appreciate your patience during these upgrades.

Administration Office
